snippet: Its algorithms are as infused with bias as any human decision, but neither it nor its audience thinks of Facebook as a news organization with editorial responsibilities.
abstract: Farhad Manjoo State of the Art column underscores degree to which Facebook is one of most powerful media organizations in world, and how it has managed to operate free from criticism because of widely held misconception that its news offerings are generated by kind of objective algorithm; points to reports raising questions about how Facebook constructs its trending news list as useful reminders of possible problems that could arise from its position of power in news industry.
lead_paragraph: Its algorithms are as infused with bias as any human decision, but neither it nor its audience thinks of Facebook as a news organization with editorial responsibilities.

headline.print_headline: Algorithms With Agendas and the Sway of Facebook
headline.main: Facebook’s Bias Is Built-In, and Bears Watching
